properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook.

  • There is a bushfire at Bullengarook that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire started near Coffeys Road and is burning within the Wombat State Forest.
  • Crews have been able to slow the spread of fire for now and will continue working over the coming days, in preparation for the dangerous fire weather expected on Thursday.
  • There is a Community Meeting being held today Monday 23rd December at 6pm at Sunbury and Macedon Ranges Specialist School (Bullengarook Campus) - 705 Bacchus Marsh Road, Bacchus Marsh.
  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 4:17pm Sunday 22nd December.
You should stay informed, monitor conditions and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation, increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing.
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: http://www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Coffeys Road and Waterloo Flat Road are closed.
  • Numerous tracks within the Wombat State Forest are closed,including Finger post Road and a number of adjoining tracks.
  • Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads over the coming days.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 08:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Incident Location:  Bullengarook
Issue Date: Monday 23 December 2024, 09:33 am
Next Update: Monday 23 December 2024, 08:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35273/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook.

- There is a bushfire at Bullengarook that is not yet under control.
- The bushfire started near Coffeys Road and is burning within the Wombat State Forest.
- Crews have been able to slow the spread of fire for now and will continue working over the coming days, in preparation for the dangerous fire weather expected on Thursday.
- There is a Community Meeting being held today Monday 23rd December at 6pm at Sunbury and Macedon Ranges Specialist School (Bullengarook Campus) - 705 Bacchus Marsh Road, Bacchus Marsh.

- This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 4:17pm Sunday 22nd December.


You should stay informed, monitor conditions and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Boolarra, Boolarra South. 

  • There is a bushfire at Barktown Rd, Boolarra South that is contained.
  • Firefighters are working to fully extinguish this fire.
  • There is currently no threat to communities, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by Wednesday, December 25 at 5.00PM or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Woodleigh
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Woodleigh. 

  • There is a bushfire at The Gurdies that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters are still working to create control lines around the fire and to extinguish any hot spots.
  • There is currently no threat to communities, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
ROADS:
  • The Bass Highway dual carriageway is open in both directions. A 40km/h speed limit is still in force to allow emergency vehicle access to the fire and water points.
  • Gurdies-St Heliers Road is now open. A 40km/h speed limit applies.
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice message issued at 05.28PM on December 22, 2024.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by Wednesday, December 25 at 5.00PM or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Bornes Hill, Dunkeld, Glenthompson, Jimmy Creek, Karabeal, Mirranatwa, Strathmore, Victoria Valley, Grampians, Victoria Point
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bornes Hill, Dunkeld, Glenthompson, Grampians, Jimmy Creek, Karabeal, Mirranatwa, Strathmore, Victoria Point, Victoria Valley.

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd that is not yet under control.
  • Moderating weather conditions overnight and today has slowed the spread of the fire.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Hotter and windier weather conditions are forecast for Christmas Day and Boxing Day. Please plan accordingly.
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire
Impacts in your area: 

  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

    Grampians National Park visitor information: 
  • The Grampians National Park is closed.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 24/12/2024 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.location: Jallukar, Londonderry, Moyston, Rhymney, Willaura North, Bellellen, Black Range, Great Western, Lake Fyans
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellellen, Black Range, Great Western, Jallukar, Lake Fyans, Londonderry, Moyston, Rhymney, Willaura North.  

  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 9.18pm Sunday 22nd December.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • Moderate weather conditions last night and this morning has slowed the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • Hotter and windier weather conditions forecast for Christmas Day and Boxing Day. Plan accordingly.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area or Stawell or Ararat.
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

    Grampians National Park visitor information:
    The Grampians National Park is CLOSED.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 24/12/2024 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Kia Ora, Willaura.


  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 3.23pm on Saturday 21/12/2024.
  • There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling  in a northerly easterly direction 
  • Milder conditions overnight and this morning have seen a reduction in fire activity however you still need to stay informed and be aware of the conditions in your area.
  • Hotter and windier weather conditions are forecast for Christmas Day and Boxing Day. Plan accordingly.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.

Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
 
Road Closures:
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park Visitor Information:
The Grampians National Park is closed to visitors. For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 24/12/2024 11:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Plan accordingly. Relief Centres Now Open: - Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. - Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell. Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page. There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Chetwynd, Connewirricoo, Kadnook, Powers Creek. 

  • There is a bushfire at Casterton-Edenhope Rd that is under control.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 24/12/2024 05:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Wartook, Zumsteins.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 1.38pm on Sunday 22 December 2024
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
  • Milder weather conditions overnight saw a reduction in fire activity. 
  • Weather conditions today will be milder however winds can be stronger and erratic at elevation so please be aware of conditions in your area.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Forecast weather conditions for Christmas and Boxing Day indicate higher temperatures with stronger northerly winds. Plan accordingly.
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

Road Closures:
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park Visitor Information:
The Grampians National Park is closed to visitors. For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 24/12/2024 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Relief Centres Now Open: - Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. - Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell. properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap, Fyans Creek
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap.
 
  •  It is Not Safe to Return to Halls Gap 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction 
  • Favourable weather conditions overnight has slowed the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • Hotter and windier conditions are forecast for Christmas Day and Boxing Day. Plan accordingly.
  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 9.42pm on Sunday 22 December 2024.
It is Not Safe to Return. 
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
  • Relief centres are open at Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat and the Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell..
  • Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

    Grampians National Park visitor information:
The Grampians National Park is closed.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 10:00 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. - Hotter and windier conditions are forecast for Christmas Day and Boxing Day. Plan accordingly. - This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 9.42pm on Sunday 22 December 2024. It is Not Safe to Return. What you should do: If you have not already left: - Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards. - Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance. If you have already left: - Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. - Relief centres are open at Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat and the Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.. - Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe. - Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings. Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.
